title: rustc can't write in internal Android filesystem
body:
On Termux's file system, `rustc` hello-world compiles, but I need to edit files from QuickEdit/Quoda editors, but they can't access hidden app data (`/data`), so how would I edit my Rust in Termux fs? On the other hand, there's the UserLAnd app (that emulates Ubuntu/Debian/Arch Linux), but I'm not sure if it works too and is not elegant.

Doing a hello-world in my internal file system fails:

```sh
$ cd /sdcard/Hydroper
$ cargo new hello-world
$ cd hello-world0
$ cargo rustc --target armv7-linux-androideabi
```

I receive this:

```
error: failed to link or copy `/storage/emulated/legacy/Hydroper
  /hello-world/target/armv7-linux-androideabi
  /debug/deps/hello_world-1a5a0f0d60d07a86`
to `/storage/emulated/legacy/Hydroper
  /hello-world/target/armv7-linux-androideabi
  /debug/hello-world`

Caused by:
  Operation not permitted (os error 1)
```

With some warnings based on the following:

```
warning: error copying object file `/storage/emulated/legacy/Hydroper
  /hello-world/target/armv7-linux-androideabi
  /debug/deps/hello_world-1a5a0f0d60d07a86.15tmymq5l8gl9bw.rcgu.o`
to incremental directory as `/storage/emulated/legacy/Hydroper
  /hello-world/target/armv7-linux-androideabi
  /debug/incremental/hello_world-2rcp0qtfldxo0/s-fahrccndht-uujlbh-working/15tmymq5l8gl9bw.o`:

    Operation not permitted (os error 1)
```

And I'm rooted (Android 5.1.1). I did `$ termux-setup-storage`.
